posts.name: Berk
posts.cooked: Hi our team wants to transfer from ctr pdp to rev pdh.Since our club has founded our club is used ctr elements so we dont have any idea for switching.If i want to switch from pdp to pdh can i still use my vrm module and do i have to buy rev radio pover module for new vh 109 radio?

posts.name: Nathan Zhou
posts.cooked:
You don‚Äôt need VRM or RPM for the new VH-109 radio.

If you are switching to REV PDH or CTRE PDP 2.0, the 40 Amp Snap Action Breaker on your old CTRE PDP (1.0) cannot be used. You would need some AT2 style 40A breaker from Andymark or REV .

Also you will need to cut the Lug Connector on your Battery cable going into your PDP as REV PDH use WAGO connector that does not require any lug.

link_counts.title: 40 Amp Snap Action Breaker - AndyMark, Inc
40A ATO Auto-resetting Breaker - 4 Pack - REV Robotics
Wiring Your Radio | FIRST FRC Radio

posts.name: Joseph Walters
posts.cooked:
Everything @NathanZhou says is correct, the switch has a few finer points, but its pretty easy.

I have a deeper question though - why switch?

Have you considered the opportunity cost of that $240 for the PDH ? As well as the additional cost for new breakers, lets say $300 total to switch over?

If you have a PDP 1.0 the switch to 2.0 gets you the slightly more aggressive breakers as well as WAGO Lever action connections instead of the PDP style. You still have CAN communication, and current/voltage/power monitoring on both.

What are the advantages to your team to switch to the PDH ? And is there a better use of that money to buy a backup radio, motor, crimping tool, metal stock, upgrade your robot cart, buy a PIT display or programming laptop, etc‚Ä¶?

I‚Äôm not saying you shouldn‚Äôt change - but want to make sure you thought out the ‚Äúwhy‚Äù - there could be a compelling reason your team needs to switch!

posts.name: Mr. Siefen | 453
posts.cooked:
Jwal:

but want to make sure you thought out the ‚Äúwhy‚Äù - there could be a compelling reason your team needs to switch

We are in the same camp as OP where we were mainly a CTRE /Vex control system team and we started buying the PDH components this season to switch for next year. Mainly because we keep running into motor count limits being short by one or two motor power ports. Agreed don‚Äôt switch until you have a compelling reason though. We started on Rev MaxSwerve last year and spark maxes when Falcons stopped being easily available before Krakens were announced.

We eventually want to move all of our components to rev as much as possible as on the bot all motors and motor controllers were REV (Neos, Vortexs or Spark Max brushed motors) until we added 2 falcons. Our IMU is now the Limelight 4, instead of a pigeon 1.0 so we usually don‚Äôt have a reason to use any CTRE libs at all except the PDP . Keeping it all in REV would be nice

posts.name: Andrew Todd
posts.cooked: Unless I‚Äôm missing something, it should pretty much be a drop-in replacement. Just remember that it uses different breakers. You can still use the VRM if you want.

posts.name: FrankJ
posts.cooked: The choice of manufacturer of the power distribution board doesn‚Äôt effect the  choice of the other components (except you have to use comparable breakers.) Personally I prefer the rev board despite the voltmeter not being accurate. The new radio does not require either a VRM or a RPM as previously stated. One less point of failure. I would stay with a board that has canbus and current monitoring.
